translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽In the order of the True Idea, in the reverse order of the True Idea, the Schedule of the Pairs in the Order and Reverse Order of the Faculties

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (6)🔽18.29. Saraṇaduka, Dassanenapahātabbadukādi🔽Saraṇaṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Araṇaṁ nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naaraṇo nanadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  saraṇa duka dassanena apahātabba duka ādi  saraṇam dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na saraṇaḥ na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā eka adhipatiyā ekaṃ pe avigate eka  araṇam na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā na araṇaḥ na na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekaṃ pe avigate eka
translated: The Triad on the Refuges, the Triad on What is to be Abjured by Seeing, etc.🔽With a non-refuge as condition there arises what is not to be abjured by seeing. (In brief.) With respect to cause there is one ; with respect to predominance there is one ; … down to … with respect to non-obstruction there is one.🔽With a non-refuge as condition there arises what is not to be abjured by development. (In brief.) With respect to cause there is one ; … down to … with respect to non-obstruction there is one. (In brief.)

original: Araṇaṁ sauttaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nasaraṇo nasauttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: araṇam sauttaram dhammam paccayā na saraṇaḥ na sauttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With a non-refuge as condition there arises what is not a refuge. (In brief.) With respect to cause there is one ; … down to … with respect to non-obstruction there is one.

original: Araṇaṁ anuttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo naanuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽(Sahajātavārampi …pe… pañhāvārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Dhammānulomapaccanīye dukadukapaṭṭhānaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: araṇam anuttaram dhammam paṭicca na saraṇaḥ na anuttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā eka adhipatiyā ekam pe avigate eka  sahajāta vāram pi pe pañhā vāram pi  dhamma anuloma paccanīye duka duka paṭṭhānam niṭṭhita
translated: Dependent on the unsurpassed, conflict-free Dhamma, the unsurpassed, conflict-free Dhamma arises. With a condition. As to root cause, one … As to prenascence, one … As to object, one … As to decisive support, one … As to non-disappearance, one.🔽(The section on the origin should be elaborated in the same way as the section on the condition.)🔽The second tetrad of the Direct Path is finished.🔽

Dependent on the unsurpassed, conflict-free Dhamma, the unsurpassed, conflict-free Dhamma arises. With a condition. As to root cause, one … As to condition, one … As to faculty, one … As to absorption, one … As to road to power, one … As to jhāna, one … As to path, one … As to fruit, one … As to nutriment, one … As to element, one … As to aggregate, one … As to sphere, one … As to contact, one … As to feeling, one … As to perception, one … As to formation, one … As to consciousness, one … As to the past, one … As to the future, one … As to the present, one … As to the peaceful, one … As to the sublime, one … As to the unsurpassed, one … As to the internal, one … As to the external, one … As to the internal and external, one … As to the bodily, one … As to the mental, one … As to the unwholesome, one … As to the result, one … As to the root cause, one … As to the condition, one … As to the faculty, one … As to the absorption, one … As to the road to power, one … As to the jhāna, one … As to the path, one … As to the fruit, one … As to the nutriment, one … As to the element, one … As to the aggregate, one … As to the sphere, one … As to the contact, one … As to the feeling, one … As to the perception, one … As to the formation, one … As to the consciousness, one … As to the past, one … As to the future, one … As to the present, one … As to the peaceful, one … As to the sublime, one … As to the unsurpassed, one … As to the internal, one … As to the external, one … As to the internal and external, one … As to the bodily, one … As to the mental, one … As to the unwholesome, one … As to the result, one … As to the root cause, one … As to the condition, one … As to the faculty, one … As to the absorption, one … As to the road to power, one … As to the jhāna, one … As to the path, one … As to the fruit, one … As to the nutriment
